components.name: uKmWaC
components.content: Funding required

components.name: FhOGcz
components.content:
We are looking to understand:

  • how much funding you are applying for from this fund
  • your full project costs
  • any funding you've already received for your project so far
  • any funding you've plan to secure for your project
  • any funding you've already received towards capital costs

We'll ask you to upload a business plan to support the answers you give us in this section.

This fund can offer up to 50% of your capital costs to renovate and repair the asset.
components.title: Help with management case

components.name: dPYuee
components.content:
Capital costs

Tell us about the total capital costs of your project.

These are used to purchase or lease the asset and pay for refurbishment costs. Remember, you can apply for up to 50% of your capital costs, up to a maximum of £250,000 (up to £1 million for sporting assets).

You can use your business plan to provide information that supports your answers.

components.name: eJdudr
components.content: Funding required

components.name: PZANlN
components.content:
We are looking to understand:

  • how much funding you are applying for from this fund
  • your full project costs
  • any funding you've already received for your project so far
  • any funding you've plan to secure for your project
  • any funding you've already received towards capital costs

We'll ask you to upload a business plan to support the answers you give us in this section.

This fund can offer up to 50% of your capital costs to renovate and repair the asset.
components.title: Help with management case

components.name: DfTiAW
components.content:
Revenue costs (optional)

Tell us about the total revenue costs of your project.

  • utilities
  • staffing
  • appointing external consultants

Remember, you can apply for up to £50,000 of your revenue costs (no more than 20% of your capital funding).

  • tell us why you need revenue funding
  • provide any information that supports your answers

components.name: ZLsNnZ

components.name: rgGQHh

  • your full project costs
  • any funding you've already received for your project so far
  • any funding you've plan to secure for your project

components.title: Help with management case

components.name: FqiBUI
components.content:
You need to raise other sources of funding alongside investment from this fund.

Having a range of funders contributing to your project can show the quality of your project and the support it has in the community.

  • public bodies
  • devolved administrations
  • charitable trusts
  • national lottery funders
  • community shares
  • social investors
  • other lenders

You can use your business plan to provide evidence to support your answers.

components.title: Help with management case

components.name: fnIdkJ
components.title: Asset value
components.hint:
This includes the building and its contents, including fixtures and fittings, and any stock.

You can use your business plan to provide evidence to support your answer.

If you have already bought or leased the asset, use its current valuation.

components.title: Help with management case

components.name: NJBCOa
components.content:
Unsecured match funding

You need to raise other sources of funding alongside investment from this fund.

Having a range of funders contributing to your project can show the quality of your project and the support it has in the community.

  • public bodies
  • devolved administrations
  • charitable trusts
  • national lottery funders
  • community shares
  • social investors
  • other lenders
  • tell us how long it will likely take to secure any outstanding match funding
  • provide any information that supports your answers

components.name: tVziRL
components.content:
Total funding request

This is the amount you are applying for from the Community Ownership Fund.

You can apply for up to 50% of your capital costs, up to a maximum of £250,000 (up to £1 million for sporting assets).

You can apply for up to £50,000 of your revenue costs (no more than 20% of your capital funding).
